glsa.title: phpSysInfo: arbitrary code execution and directory traversal
glsa.synopsis: phpSysInfo contains two vulnerabilities that can allow arbitrary code execution and local directory traversal.

background.p: phpSysInfo is a PHP system information tool.

description.p: phpSysInfo contains two vulnerabilities which could allow local files to be read or arbitrary PHP code to be executed, under the privileges of the web server process.

impact.p: An attacker could read local files or execute arbitrary code with the permissions of the user running the host web server.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: It is recommended that all Gentoo Linux users who are running www-apps/phpsysinfo upgrade to the fixed version:
resolution.code: # emerge sync # emerge -pv '>=www-apps/phpsysinfo-2.1-r1' # emerge '>=www-apps/phpsysinfo-2.1-r1' # emerge clean
